alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 12:09AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Washington and northeastern Wood Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1208 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boaz, or near Marietta, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Williamstown, Boaz, Lowell and Devola. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 185 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
